summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 5, 2019. The sheets are routine logs documenting staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The documents are reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: Routine Inmate Observation Checks
events.description: Staff at MCC New York Special Housing Unit conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on inmates in continuous locked-down status throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The documents are routine prison check sheets from the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York.
The date of the logs is August 5, 2019.
The logs document compliance with a policy requiring inmates in locked-down status to be visually observed at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
No specific inmates or staff members are named in the provided text; the logs contain only time slots and signatures/initials.
